recommendations.title: False Gods
recommendations.author: Graham McNeill
recommendations.reason: As the direct sequel to 'Horus Rising' and the second book in the pivotal Horus Heresy series, this novel continues the epic saga of betrayal and galaxy-spanning war, deepening the narrative and character arcs established in the first installment.

recommendations.title: Eisenhorn: Xenos
recommendations.author: Dan Abnett
recommendations.reason: Written by the same author as 'Horus Rising', this novel introduces the user to the acclaimed Eisenhorn series, focusing on an Inquisitor within the Warhammer 40,000 universe. It offers a thrilling blend of detective mystery, action, and deep lore, showcasing another compelling facet of the same rich setting.

recommendations.title: Brothers of the Snake
recommendations.author: Dan Abnett
recommendations.reason: Another excellent standalone novel by Dan Abnett set in the Warhammer 40,000 universe. It provides a different perspective on the Space Marines and their epic battles, offering a similar blend of grim-dark action and compelling character focus as 'Horus Rising', but without requiring knowledge of a long series.
